keep falling Wow 21 meters inside a

a dislocated shoulder and broken roof
the prospects for professor John all
were dire somehow climb out that way
using his uninjured legs that's what he
did
armed with only a Tech's capable phone

read please call global rescue another
I'll try to survive tonight bleeding
inside feels better but so cold and
longest night ever
I couldn't move my right arm was in
piercing agony my ribs were were hurting
very badly it was difficult to breathe
and I knew I was gonna die and there was
just no way to get out of a crevasse
like this people who fall into crevices
don't live John was part of a scientific
team looking at the climate's effect on
mountain areas his team had moved to a
second camp leaving him in what he
described as a safe zone I have looked
over the edge into the abyss and I know
that's not where I wanted to be and now
I can really really appreciate living
and being with my friends and family
he's now mending in Nepal and one pace
Lucas DeYoung BBC news
